result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C. Nelson

defendant.name: Nelson, Michael C.
defendant.address: N5350 Cty Tk O, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

NOT TO LEAVE THE STATE OF WISCONSIN. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.M.W. dob 8-1-2007 or RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM'S FAMILY. NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH MINORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Michael C. Nelson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Motion for Appointment of Counsel and Financial Disclosure Statement, granted in court. $200 per month beginning December 1st. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Good cause found to toll time limits to set preliminary hearing. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
